snippet: With no abatement to the fighting in Yemen, the United Nations and other aid agencies said the humanitarian crisis there was worsening.
abstract: Yemeni Army, in attempt to keep resources from Al Qaeda or other militant groups, gives control of group of oil fields to coalition of armed tribes; international aid agencies fear growing humanitarian crisis as infrastructure is destroyed in chaotic, multi-sided war.

byline.original: By SAEED AL-BATATI and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
byline.contributor: Saeed al-Batati reported from Dowaan, and David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo. Mohamed Ali Kalfood contributed reporting from Sana, Yemen; Kareem Fahim from Cairo; and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: With no abatement to the fighting in Yemen, the United Nations and other aid agencies said the humanitarian crisis there was worsening.

headline.main: Yemeni Army Tries to Safeguard Oil Fields as Qaeda Fighters Advance
headline.print_headline: Yemeni Army Tries to Keep Oil Fields From Al Qaeda

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
